item.description:
Join us as we take a “three hour tour” of the beautifully scenic Essex River Basin. Explore nature and discover wildlife paddling around islands or within the winding salt marshes. Perfect for the beginner or intermediate paddlers. This beautiful tidal estuary winds its way back and forth, eventually reaching clam flats and sand dunes behind Crane Beach Reservation, then finally through a narrow mouth to the Atlantic Ocean.

ERBA employ a variety of guides, instructors, and staff spanning all ages, backgrounds, and experience levels. The trip is well planned and orchestrated. We will met at ERBA http://www.erba.com/directions.htm at 12:00. During that time we will choose kayaks, life vests, skirts, and paddles.

Bring a bathing suit or shorts, t-shirt or a light top-layer. A light nylon rain jacket if there’s a potential for a little rain. If it’s chilly avoid jeans or sweatshirts. Cotton likes to stay wet and cold. A polar fleece and polyester tops works really well for colder days, a hat is also a good idea. Also, wear something on your feet that can get wet. And, bring sun screen, water and maybe a snack.

Later, we will meet at Shea’s Seafood Restaurant, for a great dinner in a private room overlooking the Essex river.   Cost is $55. payable directly to ERBA and your own dinner charges. Paypal is NOT available for this event.   Call or email Ben Sabatini, 508-653-8700, ben01760@comcast.net and make reservations.

 

Dinner after 5:30 at Shea’s Seafood Restaurant, 122 Main St Essex, MA. 

Light rain or shine.

No experience necessary.
item.name: Guided Kayak on the Essex River
